interestingcomments.content: That small lonely speck is the dreaded corrosion invader! The halo around the spot is the giveaway. It is just one spot and if no other show up it is easy enough to correct. In my case the number of spots grew - on the original sensor and then on the first replacement. All ok now.

interestingcomments.content: ...The black spots seem too dark to be dust, dont u think? No, I don't think so. Dust blocks light from reaching the sensor and will, hence, leave dark spots. None of the specks on your picture that I could see looks anything like sensor corrosion. If you think one of the dark spots looks particularly suspicious, you should point it out to us.

interestingcomments.content: But lunch boxes could still be usable. Once the electronics really becomes irrepairable the device is no more than a trinket or dust gatherer...
